articles.title: 236,000 More Covid Deaths In Europe By December 1: WHO's Dire Warning - NDTV
articles.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) said Monday it feared another 236,000 Covid-19 deaths in Europe by December 1, expressing concern about stagnating vaccination rates and low uptake in poorer countries.
articles.content:
World Health Organization warned about the stagnating vaccination rates in Europe. (File)
Copenhagen: The World Health Organization warned Monday that another 236,000 people could die from Covid in … [+3205 chars]

articles.author: By Sugam Pokharel, Aya Elamroussi and Saskya Vandoorne, CNN
articles.title: EU to recommend reinstating Covid-related travel restrictions on US, reports say - CNN
articles.description: The European Union is expected to recommend on Monday that member states reinstate Covid-related travel restrictions and halt nonessential travel from the United States and five other countries, a diplomatic source told CNN on Monday.
articles.content: (CNN) The European Union is expected to recommend on Monday that member states reinstate Covid-related travel restrictions and halt nonessential travel from the United States and five other countries… [+2461 chars]

articles.author: Jon Henley
articles.title: Schools across Europe must stay open, say WHO and Unicef - The Guardian
articles.description: Governments told educating children safely must be ‘primary objective’ as new school year begins
articles.content: Schools across Europe must stay open and be made safer for staff and children, the World Health Organization (WHO) and Unicef have demanded, as a new term gets under way with the highly transmissible… [+3946 chars]

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Porsche to partner Sime Darby for first assembly plant outside Europe - The Star Online
articles.description: KUALA LUMPUR: Sime Darby Bhd will partner Porsche AG to assemble sports cars for the Malaysian market only and production is scheduled to start in 2022.
